title: Unable to export Entity Change Model after upgrade
content:
After upgrading to version 25.3.x, 25.4.x, or 26.1.x, you cannot export the Entity Change Model, and you will see a an error similar to the following in the mass_dev2prod.log and mass_error.log log files:

Export with id 68e63200e4b0769b7c0b34ec failed

com.hp.maas.platform.exception.service.ServiceException: Data records without a UUID were found. Dev2Prod uses the UUID field for record reconciliation between the source and target tenants. Ask your suite administrator to perform a crawling upgrade for the current tenant so that the system automatically generates a UUID for the problematic records, and then retry.

Cause

Version 25.3 introduces a content data version increment that requires updates to Entity Model UUIDs. However, the upgrade process for versions 25.3, 25.4, and 26.1 does not include a crawling upgrade step to complete these required updates. As a result, the content data version increment is not fully applied, the entity model UUIDs remain outdated, and exporting the Entity Change Model fails.

Solution

Complete the following steps to update the UUIDs in version 25.3, 25.4, and 26.1 to ensure that the content data version increment introduced in 25.3 is applied correctly. Check the following decision table to figure out if the workaround must be applied for your upgrade path:
 
Upgrade Path   Action Required
25.2.x → 25.3.x  Apply the workaround.
25.3.x → 25.4.x Apply the workaround if you did not apply it while upgrading to 25.3.
25.3.x -> 25.4.x -> 26.1.x Apply the workaround if you did not apply it while upgrading to 25.3 or 25.4.

Prepare the script to update the UUID

  1. Download version 25.4 SMA Operation Toolkit from the OpenText Marketplace. The downloaded file contains the SMA-operation-toolkit-<version>.tar.gz file.
  2. Copy the downloaded SMA Operation Toolkit package to the control plane or the bastion node of the Suite installed environment.
  3. Run the following command to extract the SMA Operation Toolkit package. 
    cd <SMA Operation Toolkit download path>
tar -zxvf  SMA-operation-toolkit-<version>.tar.gz
  4. Go to the update_uuid_for_models directory in the extracted path. 
    cd <SMA Operation Toolkit download path>/SMA-operation-toolkit-<version>/update_uuid_for_models
  5. Change the permission of the update_uuid_for_models.sh shell script under the update_uuid_for_models directory. 
    chmod 0755 update_uuid_for_models.sh

Update the UUIDs

Now, you have two options. Either apply the fix to all tenants or to a specific tenant. 

Apply the fix to all tenants, as the issue may exist across all tenants.

Apply the fix to all the tenants:

  1. Run the following command to update the UUID for all existing Entity Models if the UUID does not exist. 
    ./update_uuid_for_models.sh
  2. The script prompts the following question. 
    No tenant specified. Run for all tenants? (Y/N):

  3. Type Y to confirm and proceed with executing the script across all tenants.

Apply a fix to a specific tenant:

 Run the following command to update the UUID for all existing Entity Models if the UUID does not exist for the given Tenant.

./update_uuid_for_models.sh -t <TenantID>

For example:

./update_uuid_for_models.sh -t 1234567
